title: My post was removed but I can't tell from the removal message whether I did something wrong
body:
The post was a short throwaway joke that I made with no animosity and all levity, intended to bring a chuckle or two (at no one's expense) to a difficult topic. The removal message starts with:

> We've recently removed your post for violating the Boards Universal Rules, primarily pertaining the rule:
> 
> Facilitate Civil Discussion- When you choose to participate in a discussion with the rest of the playerbase, always try to be respectful and receptive to another player's point of view. Also, be mindful of how you present your point of view. If a player feels strongly on a subject, don't get caught up trying to have the last word. Just state your side and exit the conversation gracefully rather than give them the opportunity to pick a fight.

Which gives me the impression that I misbehaved and offended someone somehow. But then it says:

> This has been removed because it quotes and responds to content that has been deleted and lacks context without it.

Which made me think it was simply part of cleanup and I didn't misbehave. But then it swings back to this:

> While we understand that you may be upset or frustrated, the Moderation Team does not accept this as a valid excuse to be uncivilized, and we ultimately require that all discussions on the Boards be civil.
> 
> I'd like to emphasize that this is not a warning; however, please take some time to familiarize yourself with the Boards Universal Rules, as well as the guidelines for any sub-board you intend to post in before you do so.

Which tells me that I appeared upset or frustrated and acted without civility, and, although I'm being let off without a warning this time, I should reread the rules to ensure that I don't mess up again.

I'm very confused. Did I do something wrong or not? ¯\\(°\_o)/¯

replies.body:
Without the context you provided earlier I can’t make any sort of definitive answer since I only see the notifications from Riot.

That being said there was a thread earlier that I had received several notifications about my content violating the Universal Rules and, truth be told, I could have absolutely worded my posts better in hindsight. Just take it for what it is- a lesson in what not to do again :3

> [{quoted}](name=Boltonator,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=GvyMK7Vj,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-06-21T22:33:38.837+0000)
>
> Just take it for what it is- a lesson in what not to do again :3

Which is exactly how it was intended.

> [{quoted}](name=Ulanopo,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=GvyMK7Vj,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-06-21T22:39:54.062+0000)
>
> That's the important line.

Ah, okay. Does this happen often enough that a new template might be in order, or--

>
> Which is exactly how it was intended.

...I'm confused again. Is there something I did wrong that I should avoid repeating?

>
> Which is exactly how it was intended.

Indeed. Not to derail this thread but I do apologize for my earlier posts, I’m sure you know the ones I’m referring to.

Here’s to keeping the boards civil.

>This has been removed because it quotes and responds to content that has been deleted and lacks context without it.

Sometimes, removing someone else's comment means we also need to remove yours that quotes it.

> [{quoted}](name=Ulanopo,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=GvyMK7Vj,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2019-06-22T00:04:14.973+0000)

> Sometimes, removing someone else's comment means we also need to remove yours that quotes it.

So, was the removal message intended to tell me that I did something wrong which I shouldn't do again, or was it just a bit of cleanup and I didn't do anything wrong there?

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=GvyMK7Vj,comment-id=000300000001,timestamp=2019-06-22T02:37:19.518+0000)

>

Okay, cool. Thanks for clearing up the cleanup. :)

I've had a removal like that before. I believe that the bottom two paragraphs are just part of the template they use since I'm confident that my post had nothing that broke the rules.

My post text for reference (so you can judge for yourself):

"The things that come to mind directly relates to likely answers to my question. It shouldn't be added because others just want to know so they can harass someone who starts the vote."

Edit:
As a side note, opening the "notification" window disables scrolling the page once the notification window has closed. I'm forced to reload the page.
